definition: dejected/despondent/depressed
to regret
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: Maintaining a sense of humor about these new frustrations can be helpful.
sentences.chinese: 對新出現的種種懊喪局面保持幽默感，這會有所幫助。

sentences.english: The club understand the frustrations of people not knowing.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部也理解不知情的人的懊喪。

sentences.english: Her face showed her dejection at missing the party.
sentences.chinese: 她因錯過聚會而面露懊喪之色。

sentences.english: Regret to the south, feel I dont deserve west chicken, filed for divorce.
sentences.chinese: 向南懊喪，感覺本人配不上西鳳，提出了離婚。

sentences.english: He was chagrined at his failure.
The sun never repents of the good he does, nor does he ever demand a recompence.
sentences.chinese: 太陽絕不爲它所做的善事懊喪，也從不盼望任何報酬。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
masquerade
sullen/to scowl miserably
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
hum/drone/buzz
furious/enraged
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
a short time/a little while
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
